They\'re Seasonal\n\nMustache hair grows faster than any other body hair. It sprouts more in spring and summer than in autumn and winter.
From 2000 to 2013, the total number of 200-meter-plus buildings in existence increased an astounding 318 percent from 261 to 830.
Although some self-styled experts allege mysterious natural causes or alien origin, there is a scientific consensus that nearly all crop cirlce cases are man-made.
When Van Gogh first began painting, he used peasants as models and later would paint flowers, landscapes and himself, mostly because he was too poor to pay the models.
Some superheroes, such as Batman, Green Arrow, Hawkeye and the Question possess no superhuman powers but have mastered skills such as martial arts and forensic sciences to a highly remarkable degree.
The date May 20th 1775, above the letters on the North Carolina flag recalls the Mecklenburg Declaration of Independence
A bloodhound can have up to 300 million scent receptors in its nose, as compared to the 5 million receptors that each human posesses.
Irish Wolfhounds are the biggest dogs in the land
Ulysses S. Grant was given a $20 speeding ticket for riding his horse too fast down a Washington street.
Under a microscope, a mento would resemble the appearnce of a highly cratered moon.
Animals mimic both their environment and more dangerous species in order to survive in preadatorial climates.
South Park creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone created the musical The Book of Morman, which has acquired nine Tony Awards since it\'s inception in 2011.
Actress Zooey Deschanel\'s name was taken from novelist J.D. Salinger\'s notable male character of "Franny and Zooey".

Scottish patriot King Bruce I of Scotland (who led the Wars of Scottish Independence) provided the Caped Crusader’s first name, while brigadier general Anthony Wayne (a hero of the American Revolutionary War) is responsible for the surname.
Captain America is very much worthy and during a battle he lifted Thor’s hammer and managed to use it against his foes. Never has a level of awesomeness been so high.

The Flash is faster than Superman. While Superman is enhanced by the yellow Sun, he still has to obey basic physics, including friction. The Flash is powered by the nigh-magical Speed Force, which allows him to tap into speed that others simply cannot.
Gambit\'s real name is Remy Lebeau. A thief by nature and a hero at heart. He\'s first introduced to the world by saving an age regressed Storm from the clutches of the Shadow King.

When "The Incredible Hulk" first hit the shelves, the Green Giant was actually grey. The printers were unable to keep the grey coloration consistent, and Stan Lee decided to change his color to green so it woul be easier to print.
When fully powered, Tony Stark can lift up to 100 tons in the Iron Man suit. Pretty impressive considering that the Hulk\'s maximum lift (when calm) is 100 tons as well.
Spiderman has been in love with four women! In chronological order: Betty Brant, Gwen Stacy, Felicia Hardy (aka the Black Cat), and finally Mary Jane.

Storm first appeared in Giant-Size X-Men #1 (1975) written by Len Wein and penciled by Dave Cockrum. She was one of the first black comic book characters, and is the first black female in mainstream comics.
The most bizarre form of kryptonite was surely the pink version from an alternate timeline, unveiled in “Supergirl (Vol. 4) No. 79.” Instead of weakening Superman, it leaves him with gay tendencies.

Wonder Woman\'s bracelets keep her powers in-check. Wonder Woman once removed her bracelets in order to fight a God, explaining that the bracelets are what actually protected her opponents from her intense power.
